intro: Phyllorkis oxyptera, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wallaby rattail, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Phyllorkis oxyptera is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in coastal and inland areas.
